info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 22 at 9:13PM MDT until July 22 at 11:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of Otero County in southern New Mexico including Mescalero, Nogal Canyon, and South Tularosa Canyon.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 913 PM MDT, Slow moving thunderstorms continue to impact the west slopes of the Sacramento Mountains. Up to an inch of rain has fallen over the head of Nogal Canyon and Laborcita Canyon, near the Seven Springs Fire burn area, and up to a half inch around Mescalero and Soldier's Canyon to the north. Heavy rainfall is just beginning to edge into South Tularosa Canyon, which has been hard hit by recent flooding. - Areas are being monitored closely for possible Flash Flood Warnings. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mescalero, Upper and Lower Nogal Canyon, Laborcita Canyon and Soldier Canyon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING
